bug.short_desc: mute mic key does not work
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
the f keys functions (volume, brightness etc) all work fine with fedora on my new thinkpad t460 however the mute mic key does not work, it does not mute or unmute the mic and the light does not come on when the key is pressed. It does not seem to respond at all.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. 2. 3.
Actual results:
Expected results:
Additional info:
What Version of Fedora are you using?
and what exact model of the T460? the T460s or T460p?

fefora 23, Laptop just says T460 - the serial no is PC0BSYXK if that helps.
It's new, I got it about a month ago.

Ok, I tested a T460s, a T460p and a X1 Carbon 4th gen on a internal test RHEL 7 and checked they keycodes with "xev" and "showkey -s" (as root). On the T460p and the X1 Carbon 4th Gen I get key codes for the mute key. On the T460s I do not get any key code, like if the key was not even pressed.
Can you check with either "xev" or "showkey -s" if you get a key code from pressing the key?
I put xev in commandline and evey action I took seemed to generate a few lines of info, but pressing f4 (mic mute) did not generate anything.

mmhh.. ok.. lets wait for one of the developers to respond..
What I found in the meantime is, that it seems to be a kernel bug: https://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=114731
and the patch is discussed here: https://sourceforge.net/p/ibm-acpi/mailman/message/34988427/
I am changing the Component to kernel, as this seems to be appropriate.
can you please also run: uname -a and copy the output here, so the team knows what kernel version you are running
This seems to have been fixed by a recent update :)

This is still an issue for me. Lenovo T460s, as above.
$ uname -a Linux redbox 4.6.6-300.fc24.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Aug 10 21:07:35 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
The 'xev' process doesn't show input for this button, though the volume related buttons do.

*********** MASS BUG UPDATE **************
We apologize for the inconvenience. There is a large number of bugs to go through and several of them have gone stale. Due to this, we are doing a mass bug update across all of the Fedora 23 kernel bugs.
Fedora 23 has now been rebased to 4.7.4-100.fc23. Please test this kernel update (or newer) and let us know if you issue has been resolved or if it is still present with the newer kernel.
If you have moved on to Fedora 24 or 25, and are still experiencing this issue, please change the version to Fedora 24 or 25.
If you experience different issues, please open a new bug report for those.

And it's no longer an issue:
$ uname -a Linux redbox 4.7.3-200.fc24.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Sep 7 17:31:21 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
I'm unsure what fixed it, but it's fixed.

this is still happening on fedora 25 uname -a Linux teds-x270 4.8.6-300.fc25.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Nov 1 12:36:38 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
THinkpad x270, exact same symptoms as everyone has described. xev captures other keys except fn+f4 (the mic mute button), no output at all, it's as if it were never pressed. (they key works though, I can use alt-f4 to close windows, and the fn key works as fn+ other keys works as expected.)
